name: Classic Protein Pancakes
description: Fluffy pancakes packed with protein, perfect for muscle building
instructions: Blend oats in a food processor until they form a flour-like consistency.
Add protein powder, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, and vanilla. Blend until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly coat with cooking spray.
Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake onto the pan.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes, then flip.
Cook another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Serve topped with mixed berries and sugar-free syrup.

name: Overnight Protein Oats
description: No-cook overnight oats with extra protein for busy mornings
instructions: In a jar or container, combine oats, protein powder, Greek yogurt, and almond milk.
Stir in chia seeds and PB Fit until well combined.
Cover and refrigerate overnight, or at least 4 hours.
In the morning, top with mixed berries.
Can be eaten cold or microwaved for 1-2 minutes.

name: High-Protein Egg Muffins
description: Portable egg muffins loaded with veggies and protein
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F (175C) and grease a 12-cup muffin tin.
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs and egg whites.
Stir in cooked turkey sausage, bell peppers, spinach, and onion.
Season with salt and pepper.
Divide mixture evenly among muffin cups (about 2/3 full).
Sprinkle cheese on top of each.
Bake for 22-25 minutes until set and slightly golden.
Let cool slightly before removing from tin.
Store in refrigerator for up to 5 days.

name: Greek Yogurt Protein Bowl
description: Creamy Greek yogurt bowl with nuts and seeds for sustained energy
instructions: Add Greek yogurt to a bowl.
Stir in protein powder until smooth.
Top with mixed berries, sliced almonds, and chia seeds.
Drizzle with honey if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Muscle Builder Breakfast Burrito
description: Loaded breakfast burrito with eggs, meat, and cheese
instructions: Cook turkey sausage in a skillet until browned and crumbled.
Whisk eggs and egg whites together, add to skillet with sausage.
Scramble until eggs are cooked through.
Warm black beans in microwave for 30 seconds.
Warm tortillas in a dry pan or microwave.
Divide egg mixture between tortillas.
Top with black beans, cheese, salsa, and avocado slices.
Roll up burrito style, tucking in the ends.
Can be wrapped in foil and frozen for meal prep.

name: Cottage Cheese Power Bowl
description: High-protein cottage cheese with fruit and granola
instructions: Add cottage cheese to a bowl.
Top with mixed berries and granola.
Sprinkle chopped walnuts on top.
Drizzle with honey and dust with cinnamon.
Serve immediately.

name: Protein Smoothie Bowl
description: Thick and creamy smoothie bowl with crunchy toppings
instructions: Add frozen berries, protein powder, Greek yogurt, almond milk, and PB Fit to a blender.
Blend until thick and creamy (should be thicker than a regular smoothie).
Pour into a bowl.
Top with granola, chia seeds, and sliced almonds.
Serve immediately.

name: Avocado Toast with Eggs
description: Classic avocado toast topped with perfectly cooked eggs
instructions: Toast bread until golden and crispy.
While bread toasts, fry or poach eggs to desired doneness.
Mash avocado with lemon juice and a pinch of salt.
Spread mashed avocado on toast slices.
Top each slice with an egg.
Add cherry tomato halves.
Sprinkle with everything bagel seasoning and red pepper flakes.

name: Quick Protein Shake
description: Simple high-protein shake for on-the-go mornings
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend on high for 30-60 seconds until smooth.
Pour into a shaker bottle or glass.
Drink immediately or take on the go.

name: Microwave Egg White Omelette
description: Fast microwave omelette when you are short on time
instructions: Spray a microwave-safe bowl with cooking spray.
Whisk egg whites with salt and pepper.
Add spinach and ham to the bowl.
Pour egg whites over top.
Microwave on high for 2 minutes, stir, then microwave 1-2 more minutes until set.
Top with shredded cheese.
Let cheese melt for 30 seconds before serving.

name: Peanut Butter Banana Toast
description: Classic PB and banana on whole grain toast with protein boost

ingredients.notes: mixed with water to make paste

instructions: Toast bread until golden.
Mix PB Fit with a small amount of water to create a spreadable paste.
Spread PB Fit mixture on toast slices.
Top with sliced yellow kiwi.
Sprinkle with chia seeds and drizzle with honey.

name: Turkey Bacon and Egg Sandwich
description: Quick breakfast sandwich with lean turkey bacon
instructions: Cook turkey bacon in a skillet until crispy. Set aside.
In the same pan, fry eggs to desired doneness.
Toast English muffin.
Layer bottom muffin half with spinach, then cheese.
Add eggs and turkey bacon.
Top with other muffin half.

name: Meal Prep Steel Cut Oats
description: Make-ahead steel cut oats for the whole week
instructions: Combine oats, water, and almond milk in a large pot.
Add cinnamon, vanilla, and salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
Simmer for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until oats are tender.
Stir in maple syrup if using.
Divide into 5 containers for the week.
Refrigerate for up to 5 days.
Reheat in microwave with a splash of milk.
Add protein powder and toppings when serving.

name: Freezer-Friendly Breakfast Burritos
description: Make a batch and freeze for quick morning meals
instructions: Cook turkey sausage in a large skillet, breaking into crumbles.
Add bell peppers and onion, cook until softened.
Whisk eggs and add to skillet, scrambling until cooked.
Stir in black beans and warm through.
Remove from heat and stir in cheese.
Warm tortillas and divide filling among them.
Add salsa to each and roll up burrito style.
Wrap each burrito in foil and place in freezer bags.
Freeze for up to 3 months.
Reheat from frozen in microwave for 2-3 minutes.

name: Baked Oatmeal Cups
description: Portable baked oatmeal muffins for grab-and-go breakfasts
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F (175C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin.
Mix oats, protein powder, baking powder, and cinnamon in a large bowl.
Whisk eggs, almond milk, maple syrup, and vanilla in another bowl.
Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir to combine.
Fold in mixed berries.
Divide batter among muffin cups.
Bake for 22-25 minutes until set and golden.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing.
Store in refrigerator for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 2 months.

name: Protein Chia Pudding
description: Make-ahead chia pudding with extra protein
instructions: Whisk almond milk and protein powder together until smooth.
Add chia seeds, vanilla, and maple syrup. Stir well.
Divide among 4 jars or containers.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Stir before serving and top with mixed berries.
Keeps in refrigerator for up to 5 days.

name: Egg White Veggie Scramble
description: Low-calorie, high-protein scramble loaded with vegetables
instructions: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add mushrooms, bell peppers, and onion. Saute for 3-4 minutes.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Pour in egg whites and scramble until cooked through.
Remove from heat and top with feta cheese and fresh herbs.

name: Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese Roll-Ups
description: Low-carb breakfast with healthy fats and protein
instructions: Lay smoked salmon slices flat on a plate.
Spread cream cheese over each slice.
Add cucumber slices, capers, and red onion.
Roll up each salmon slice.
Drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh dill.
Serve immediately.

name: Cauliflower Hash with Eggs
description: Low-carb alternative to traditional hash browns
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add turkey bacon and cook until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Add onion and cauliflower to skillet. Season with paprika, salt, and pepper.
Cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until cauliflower is golden.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Make 4 wells in the hash and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes until eggs are set.
Top with crispy bacon and green onions.

name: Zucchini and Egg Breakfast Boats
description: Baked zucchini stuffed with eggs and cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Cut zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds to create a boat.
Place on a baking sheet, brush with olive oil, and season with garlic powder.
Bake for 10 minutes to soften slightly.
Crack an egg into each zucchini boat.
Top with cherry tomatoes and mozzarella.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until eggs are set.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

name: Japanese Tamagoyaki (Rolled Omelette)
description: Light and fluffy Japanese-style rolled omelette
instructions: Whisk eggs, dashi, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar until well combined.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium-low heat and lightly oil.
Pour a thin layer of egg mixture into the pan.
When almost set, roll the egg to one side of the pan.
Add more egg mixture to the empty side, lifting the roll to let it flow underneath.
When set, roll again. Repeat until all egg is used.
Remove from pan and let rest 2 minutes.
Slice into rounds and serve with soy sauce.

name: Mexican Chilaquiles with Eggs
description: Crispy tortilla chips in salsa topped with fried eggs
instructions: Heat salsa verde in a large skillet until simmering.
Add tortilla chips and toss to coat. Cook 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
In a separate pan, fry eggs to desired doneness.
Divide chilaquiles between plates.
Top each with fried eggs.
Garnish with queso fresco, sour cream, red onion, cilantro, and avocado.

name: Mediterranean Shakshuka
description: Eggs poached in spiced tomato sauce
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and bell pepper. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, paprika, and cayenne. Cook 1 minute.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Make 6 wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each.
Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes until eggs are set.
Top with feta and parsley. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Korean Egg Rice Bowl (Gyeran Bap)
description: Simple Korean comfort food with runny egg over rice
instructions: Place hot rice in a bowl.
Fry eggs in butter until whites are set but yolks are runny.
Place eggs on top of rice.
Drizzle with sesame oil and soy sauce.
Top with green onions, sesame seeds, and gochugaru.
Mix everything together before eating.

name: British Full Breakfast (Lighter Version)
description: Classic British breakfast with healthier protein swaps
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Arrange turkey bacon and sausages on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet. Saute mushrooms until golden.
Add cherry tomatoes to the pan and cook until slightly softened.
In another pan, fry or poach eggs to desired doneness.
Warm baked beans in a small saucepan.
Toast bread.
Arrange all components on plates and serve.

name: Sweet Potato and Egg Hash
description: Filling sweet potato hash with perfectly cooked eggs
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sweet potato cubes and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add onion and bell pepper. Cook for 5 more minutes.
Push vegetables to the side and add turkey sausage. Cook until browned.
Mix everything together and season with smoked paprika.
Make 4 wells and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes until eggs are set.
Garnish with fresh parsley.

name: Protein-Packed Acai Bowl
description: Antioxidant-rich acai bowl with added protein
instructions: Break frozen acai packet into pieces.
Add acai, frozen berries, protein powder, and almond milk to a blender.
Blend until thick and smooth (thicker than a smoothie).
Pour into a bowl.
Top with granola, almonds, coconut, and fresh strawberries.
Serve immediately.

name: Savory Oatmeal with Egg
description: Unique savory take on classic oatmeal with a fried egg
instructions: Bring chicken broth to a boil in a saucepan.
Add oats, reduce heat, and simmer for 10-12 minutes until tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
While oats cook, fry egg to desired doneness.
Pour oatmeal into a bowl.
Top with fried egg, cheddar cheese, and green onions.
Add hot sauce if desired.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Peppers
description: Baked bell peppers filled with eggs, spinach, and feta
instructions: Preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
Place cut-side up in a baking dish and brush with olive oil.
Saute spinach with garlic until wilted. Divide among pepper halves.
Add sun-dried tomatoes and half the feta to each pepper.
Crack an egg into each pepper half.
Sprinkle with remaining feta and Italian seasoning.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until eggs are set.

name: Chocolate Protein Waffles
description: Decadent chocolate waffles that are still high in protein
instructions: Blend oats into a flour consistency.
Add all ingredients except berries to the blender.
Blend until smooth batter forms.
Preheat waffle iron and spray with cooking spray.
Pour batter into waffle iron and cook until golden.
Repeat with remaining batter.
Serve topped with fresh berries.

name: Powerlifter Protein Pancakes
description: Simple oat-based pancakes with protein powder, eggs, and banana for sustained energy during heavy lifts
instructions: Add oats to a blender and pulse until they form a coarse flour.
Add protein powder, eggs, mashed yellow kiwi, baking powder, cinnamon, and almond milk.
Blend until smooth batter forms, about 30 seconds.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and coat with cooking spray.
Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake onto the skillet.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Repeat with remaining batter to make 6 pancakes.
Serve warm with sugar-free maple syrup.

name: Egg White Veggie Omelette
description: Light and fluffy egg white omelette loaded with vegetables and tangy feta cheese
instructions: Heat olive oil in a 10-inch non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add onion and bell peppers, saute for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and spinach, cook for 1 minute until spinach wilts. Transfer to a plate.
Whisk egg whites, whole egg, salt, and pepper together until frothy.
Wipe the skillet clean and return to medium heat with a light spray of cooking oil.
Pour egg mixture into the skillet, swirling to cover the entire surface.
Let cook undisturbed for 1-2 minutes until edges set.
Spoon sauteed vegetables onto one half of the omelette.
Sprinkle feta cheese over the vegetables.
Gently fold the other half over the filling using a spatula.
Cook for 30 more seconds, then slide onto a plate.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.

name: Cottage Cheese Protein Bowl
description: Creamy cottage cheese bowl with fresh berries, crunchy granola, and a drizzle of honey - perfect post-workout recovery meal
instructions: Add cottage cheese to a large bowl.
Arrange fresh berries on one side of the bowl.
Add granola to another section of the bowl.
Sprinkle chia seeds and sliced almonds over the top.
Drizzle honey evenly across the bowl.
Dust with cinnamon.
Serve immediately to keep granola crunchy.
Mix everything together before eating or enjoy in sections.

name: High-Protein Breakfast Burrito
description: Hearty breakfast burrito stuffed with scrambled eggs, turkey sausage, cheese, and peppers - ideal pre-workout fuel
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add turkey sausage and break into crumbles with a spatula.
Cook for 5-6 minutes until browned and cooked through.
Add bell peppers and onion to the skillet, cook for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Whisk eggs and egg whites together with salt and pepper.
Push sausage and veggies to one side, pour eggs into the empty space.
Scramble eggs until just set, then mix everything together.
Warm tortillas in a dry pan or microwave for 20 seconds.
Divide egg mixture between the two tortillas.
Top each with cheese, salsa, and Greek yogurt.
Add hot sauce if desired.
Fold in the sides, then roll up tightly from the bottom.
Optional: Toast seam-side down in a dry pan for a crispy exterior.

name: Ultimate Overnight Protein Oats
description: No-cook overnight oats with protein powder, Greek yogurt, and chia seeds for maximum muscle recovery
instructions: In a mason jar or container with a lid, add oats, protein powder, and chia seeds.
Pour in Greek yogurt and almond milk.
Add honey, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
Stir vigorously until protein powder is fully dissolved with no lumps.
Mix PB Fit with water to make a paste, swirl on top.
Cover tightly and refrigerate for at least 6 hours or overnight.
In the morning, stir well - add more almond milk if too thick.
Top with fresh berries.
Can be eaten cold or microwaved for 1-2 minutes if preferred warm.

name: Smoked Salmon Bagel Stack
description: Loaded bagel with cream cheese, smoked salmon, capers, and red onion - omega-3 rich for joint health
instructions: Slice bagel in half and toast until golden brown.
Spread cream cheese evenly on both halves.
Layer smoked salmon slices on top of the cream cheese.
Scatter capers and red onion rings over the salmon.
Add cucumber slices if using.
Sprinkle fresh dill over the top.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over everything.
Finish with freshly cracked black pepper.
Serve open-faced or close into a sandwich.

name: Turkey Bacon Egg Cups
description: Baked egg cups wrapped in turkey bacon with melted cheese - perfect grab-and-go protein for busy mornings
instructions: Preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Spray a 6-cup muffin tin generously with cooking spray.
Partially cook turkey bacon in a skillet for 2-3 minutes (should still be flexible).
Line each muffin cup with 2 strips of turkey bacon, creating a basket shape.
The bacon should come up the sides and slightly overlap.
Sprinkle a small amount of cheese into the bottom of each bacon cup.
Crack one egg into each bacon-lined cup.
Season each egg with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Top with remaining cheese.
Add a cherry tomato half to each cup if using.
Bake for 18-22 minutes until egg whites are set but yolks are still slightly soft.
For fully cooked yolks, bake an additional 3-5 minutes.
Let cool in the tin for 2 minutes before removing.
Garnish with fresh chives and serve.
Store leftovers in refrigerator for up to 4 days. Reheat in microwave for 30-45 seconds.

name: High-Protein Smoothie Bowl
description: Thick and creamy smoothie bowl with protein powder, frozen berries, and banana topped with crunchy granola - ultimate post-workout recovery
instructions: Add protein powder, frozen berries, frozen kiwi, Greek yogurt, and almond milk to a high-speed blender.
Blend on low speed, using the tamper to push ingredients down.
Blend until thick and creamy - consistency should be like soft-serve ice cream.
Add more almond milk 1 tbsp at a time only if needed to blend.
Pour into a deep bowl.
Arrange toppings in rows: granola, sliced almonds, chia seeds, and coconut flakes.
Drizzle with honey if desired.
Serve immediately with a spoon.
Eat quickly before it melts for best texture.

name: 5-Minute Protein Yogurt Parfait
description: Lightning-fast layered parfait with Greek yogurt, berries, and crunchy granola for busy mornings
instructions: Mix protein powder into Greek yogurt until smooth.
Add half the yogurt mixture to a tall glass or jar.
Layer half the berries and half the granola on top.
Add remaining yogurt mixture.
Top with remaining berries and granola.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle chia seeds.
Serve immediately or eat on the go.

name: Instant Protein Oatmeal
description: Microwave oatmeal boosted with protein powder and topped with mixed berries
instructions: Combine oats and almond milk in a microwave-safe bowl.
Microwave on high for 2-3 minutes, stirring halfway.
Let cool for 1 minute, then stir in protein powder until smooth.
Add cinnamon and mix well.
Top with mixed berries and drizzle with honey.
Serve immediately.

name: Quick Scrambled Egg Whites
description: Fast and fluffy egg white scramble with herbs and cheese
instructions: Spray a non-stick pan with cooking spray and heat over medium heat.
Whisk egg whites with salt and pepper.
Pour into the hot pan and let sit for 30 seconds.
Gently push eggs from edges to center, forming soft curds.
When almost set, remove from heat.
Top with cheese and chives.
Serve immediately.

name: PB Fit Protein Toast
description: Whole grain toast with protein-packed PB Fit spread and fresh fruit
instructions: Toast bread until golden and crispy.
Mix PB Fit with water and protein powder until smooth.
Spread PB Fit mixture evenly on both toast slices.
Top with sliced strawberries.
Sprinkle with chia seeds and drizzle with honey.
Serve immediately.

name: Steak and Eggs Breakfast
description: Classic diner-style steak and eggs for serious protein intake
instructions: Season steak with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a cast iron skillet over high heat.
Add steak and sear for 3-4 minutes per side for medium.
Add garlic and rosemary in the last minute.
Remove steak and let rest for 5 minutes.
In the same pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Fry eggs to desired doneness.
Slice steak and serve alongside eggs.

name: Triple Protein Scramble
description: Scrambled eggs with turkey sausage and cottage cheese for maximum protein
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add turkey sausage and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add spinach and cook until wilted.
Whisk eggs and egg whites together.
Pour over sausage and spinach.
Scramble until almost set.
Remove from heat and fold in cottage cheese.
Season and top with chives.

name: Protein-Loaded French Toast
description: French toast dipped in protein-enriched egg batter with Greek yogurt topping
instructions: Whisk eggs, protein powder, almond milk, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Heat a griddle or pan over medium heat with cooking spray.
Dip each bread slice in the egg mixture, coating both sides.
Cook for 3-4 minutes per side until golden.
Serve topped with Greek yogurt and mixed berries.

name: Greek Yogurt Protein Pancakes
description: Extra fluffy pancakes made with Greek yogurt and protein powder
instructions: Mix Greek yogurt, eggs, protein powder, and vanilla in a bowl.
Add oat flour and baking powder, stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake.
Cook until bubbles form, flip and cook 2 more minutes.
Serve topped with strawberries and sugar-free syrup.

name: Meal Prep Egg White Bites
description: Sous-vide style egg bites perfect for weekly meal prep
instructions: Preheat oven to 325F (165C).
Blend egg whites, eggs, and cottage cheese until smooth.
Stir in Gruyere, turkey bacon, green onions, salt, and pepper.
Grease a 12-cup silicone muffin mold.
Pour mixture evenly into molds.
Place mold in a water bath (baking dish with 1 inch water).
Bake for 30-35 minutes until set.
Cool and refrigerate for up to 5 days.
Reheat in microwave for 30-45 seconds.

name: Mason Jar Overnight Oats
description: Prepare 5 jars of protein oats for the entire work week
instructions: Prepare 5 mason jars or containers.
Add 1/2 cup oats and 1 scoop protein to each jar.
Add 1/2 cup yogurt and 1/2 cup almond milk to each.
Add 1 tbsp chia seeds and 1 tbsp PB Fit to each.
Drizzle 1 tsp honey into each jar.
Stir each jar thoroughly.
Top each with 1/4 cup berries.
Seal and refrigerate for up to 5 days.
Grab and eat cold or microwave 1-2 minutes.

name: Freezer-Friendly Protein Waffles
description: Batch-cook protein waffles and freeze for toaster-ready breakfasts
instructions: Mix all dry ingredients in a large bowl.
Whisk wet ingredients in another bowl.
Combine wet and dry, stirring until smooth.
Heat waffle iron and grease lightly.
Pour batter and cook until golden.
Let waffles cool completely.
Place in single layer on baking sheet, freeze 1 hour.
Transfer to freezer bags, stores up to 2 months.
Toast from frozen for 3-4 minutes.

name: Sheet Pan Breakfast Prep
description: One-pan meal prep with turkey sausage, eggs, and roasted vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Toss vegetables with olive oil and Italian seasoning.
Spread vegetables on one side of sheet pan.
Add sausage links to the other side.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Create 8 wells in the vegetables and crack eggs into them.
Bake 8-10 more minutes until eggs are set.
Divide into 4 containers for meal prep.
Refrigerate up to 4 days.

name: Keto Cloud Eggs
description: Fluffy baked egg whites with yolk center and crispy turkey bacon
instructions: Preheat oven to 450F (230C).
Separate egg yolks (keep intact) from whites.
Whip egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Fold in parmesan, turkey bacon, salt, and pepper.
Form 4 mounds on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Create a well in each mound.
Bake for 3 minutes.
Carefully add a yolk to each well.
Bake 3-4 more minutes until yolks are set but soft.
Garnish with chives and serve immediately.

name: Avocado Egg Boats
description: Baked eggs inside avocado halves with cheese and herbs
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Cut avocados in half and remove pits.
Scoop out some flesh to make room for eggs.
Place avocados in a muffin tin to stabilize.
Crack a small egg into each half.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 15-18 minutes until whites are set.
Top with crumbled bacon, cheese, and cilantro.
Add hot sauce if desired.

name: Keto Breakfast Sausage Patties
description: Homemade seasoned turkey sausage patties with zero carbs
instructions: Combine ground turkey with all seasonings.
Mix well with hands until evenly distributed.
Divide into 8 equal portions.
Form each portion into a flat patty.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook patties 5-6 minutes per side until cooked through.
Internal temperature should reach 165F.
Serve immediately or store for meal prep.
Freeze extras for up to 3 months.

name: Crustless Quiche Lorraine
description: Classic quiche without the crust for a low-carb option
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F (175C).
Butter a 9-inch pie dish.
Saute onion until translucent.
Whisk eggs, cream, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Layer bacon and cheese in the pie dish.
Add sauteed onion.
Pour egg mixture over top.
Bake 35-40 minutes until set and golden.
Let rest 10 minutes before slicing.

name: Mexican Huevos Rancheros
description: Traditional Mexican breakfast with eggs, black beans, and salsa
instructions: Warm black beans in a small saucepan with a splash of water.
Heat tortillas in a dry pan until pliable.
In the same pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Fry eggs sunny side up until whites are set.
Place 2 tortillas on each plate.
Spread beans on tortillas.
Top each with a fried egg.
Spoon salsa over eggs.
Add avocado, queso fresco, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedge.

name: Japanese Breakfast Bowl
description: Traditional Japanese breakfast with white rice, salmon, miso soup, and tamagoyaki
instructions: Season salmon with salt and broil for 8-10 minutes until cooked.
Whisk eggs with soy sauce and mirin for tamagoyaki.
Make rolled omelette in a pan, adding egg in thin layers.
Prepare miso soup: heat 2 cups water, dissolve miso, add tofu.
Divide rice between bowls.
Add salmon fillet alongside rice.
Slice tamagoyaki and place in bowl.
Serve miso soup on the side.
Garnish with nori and green onions.

name: Mediterranean Avocado Toast
description: Creamy avocado toast with feta, tomatoes, and za atar seasoning
instructions: Toast bread until golden and crispy.
Mash avocado with lemon juice and a pinch of salt.
Spread avocado mixture on toast.
Top with cherry tomato halves.
Sprinkle feta cheese over tomatoes.
Add za atar seasoning and red pepper flakes.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Garnish with fresh mint.

name: Indian Masala Egg Scramble
description: Spiced Indian-style scrambled eggs with onions, tomatoes, and cilantro
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add green chili and cook 1 minute.
Add tomato, turmeric, cumin, and garam masala.
Cook until tomatoes soften, about 3 minutes.
Beat eggs with salt and pour into the pan.
Scramble gently until eggs are just set.
Remove from heat and garnish with cilantro.
Serve with whole grain toast or paratha.

name: Turkish Menemen
description: Traditional Turkish eggs cooked in tomato and pepper sauce
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Saute onion and bell pepper for 5 minutes.
Add garlic, paprika, cumin, and red pepper flakes.
Cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and cook 8-10 minutes until saucy.
Create 4 wells and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook 5-7 minutes until eggs are set.
Garnish with parsley and feta.
Serve with crusty bread.

name: Green Protein Power Smoothie
description: Nutrient-dense green smoothie with spinach, protein, and healthy fats
instructions: Add almond milk and spinach to blender first.
Blend until spinach is fully broken down.
Add protein powder, kiwi, avocado, and PB Fit.
Add ice and blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into glass and top with chia seeds.
Drink immediately.

name: Chocolate PB Fit Protein Shake
description: Rich chocolate shake with PB Fit for a decadent yet healthy breakfast
instructions: Add almond milk and Greek yogurt to blender.
Add protein powder, PB Fit, and cocoa powder.
Add ice cubes and stevia if using.
Blend on high until smooth and frothy.
Pour into a tall glass.
Drink immediately.

name: Berry Blast Protein Bowl
description: Thick and creamy mixed berry bowl with protein and crunchy toppings
instructions: Add frozen berries, protein powder, yogurt, and almond milk to blender.
Blend until thick and smooth, scraping down sides as needed.
Pour into a deep bowl.
Arrange toppings in sections: granola, fresh blueberries, almonds.
Sprinkle coconut flakes and chia seeds.
Eat immediately with a spoon.

name: Tropical Mango Protein Smoothie
description: Refreshing tropical smoothie with mango, coconut, and protein
instructions: Add coconut milk and Greek yogurt to blender.
Add frozen mango, protein powder, and lime juice.
Add ice and blend until smooth.
Pour into glass.
Top with coconut flakes.
Serve immediately.

name: Classic Eggs Benedict (Lighter)
description: Traditional eggs benedict with turkey Canadian bacon and lighter hollandaise
instructions: Make lighter hollandaise: whisk yogurt, egg yolk, lemon juice, mustard, and cayenne.
Gently warm hollandaise in a double boiler, whisking constantly.
Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer with vinegar.
Create a swirl and poach eggs for 3-4 minutes.
Toast English muffins.
Heat Canadian bacon in a pan.
Assemble: muffin halves, Canadian bacon, poached eggs.
Drizzle warm hollandaise over top.
Garnish with chives and cayenne.

name: Spanish Tortilla (Potato Omelette)
description: Classic Spanish egg and potato dish, lighter version with egg whites
instructions: Heat olive oil in a 10-inch non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add potatoes and onion, season with salt.
Cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender.
Whisk eggs and egg whites with pepper.
Pour egg mixture over potatoes.
Cook for 5 minutes until bottom is set.
Carefully flip using a plate.
Cook 5 more minutes until cooked through.
Slide onto serving plate and garnish with parsley.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Denver Omelette
description: Classic American omelette with ham, peppers, and onions
instructions: Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Saute bell pepper and onion for 3-4 minutes.
Add ham and cook 1 minute.
Beat eggs with salt and pepper.
Pour eggs over vegetables.
Let set for 1-2 minutes, then gently push edges to center.
When almost set, add cheese to one half.
Fold omelette in half.
Cook 30 seconds more.
Slide onto plate and garnish with chives.

name: Egg White Frittata with Vegetables
description: Fluffy egg white frittata packed with colorful vegetables
instructions: Preheat broiler to high.
Whisk egg whites and eggs with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
Add red onion and zucchini, cook 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook 2 more minutes.
Pour egg mixture over vegetables.
Cook without stirring for 5 minutes until edges set.
Sprinkle parmesan on top.
Broil 3-4 minutes until golden and set.
Top with fresh basil before serving.

name: Apple Cinnamon Protein Oatmeal
description: Warm apple pie flavored oatmeal with protein boost
instructions: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan.
Add oats and reduce heat to simmer.
Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add diced apple, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Cook 5 more minutes until apple is tender.
Remove from heat and let cool 2 minutes.
Stir in protein powder until smooth.
Top with walnuts and drizzle with honey.

name: Blueberry Almond Oatmeal
description: Antioxidant-rich blueberry oatmeal with sliced almonds
instructions: Bring almond milk to a boil in a saucepan.
Add oats and salt, reduce heat to simmer.
Cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add almond extract and stir.
Remove from heat and let cool 2 minutes.
Stir in protein powder until smooth.
Top with fresh blueberries and sliced almonds.
Drizzle with honey.

name: Pumpkin Spice Protein Oats
description: Fall-inspired pumpkin oatmeal with warming spices and protein
instructions: Bring almond milk to a boil.
Add oats and reduce heat to simmer.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add pumpkin puree and pumpkin pie spice.
Cook 5 more minutes until creamy.
Remove from heat, let cool 2 minutes.
Stir in protein powder until smooth.
Top with pecans and pepitas.
Drizzle with maple syrup.

name: Chocolate Coconut Oatmeal
description: Indulgent chocolate oatmeal with toasted coconut and protein
instructions: Bring coconut milk to a boil.
Add oats and cocoa powder, reduce heat.
Simmer for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and let cool 2 minutes.
Stir in protein powder until smooth.
Top with toasted coconut and chocolate chips.
Drizzle with honey.
Let chocolate chips melt slightly before eating.

name: Savory Cheese and Herb Waffles
description: Savory protein waffles with cheese and herbs, perfect with eggs
instructions: Mix oat flour, baking powder, garlic powder, and salt.
Whisk eggs, yogurt, and almond milk separately.
Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Fold in cheese, chives, and thyme.
Heat waffle iron and grease lightly.
Pour batter and cook until golden.
Serve topped with a fried egg.

name: Sweet Ricotta Toast
description: Light and creamy ricotta on toast with honey and fresh fruit
instructions: Toast bread until golden.
Mix ricotta with protein powder and lemon zest.
Spread ricotta mixture on toast.
Top with sliced strawberries.
Drizzle with honey.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

name: Bacon Spinach Protein Muffins
description: Savory muffins with turkey bacon, spinach, and eggs for meal prep
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F (175C).
Mix oat flour, baking powder, and garlic powder.
Whisk eggs, yogurt, olive oil, and almond milk.
Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Fold in bacon, spinach, and cheese.
Divide batter among 12 greased muffin cups.
Bake for 22-25 minutes until golden.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes.
Store in refrigerator up to 5 days.

name: Stuffed French Toast Roll-Ups
description: Rolled French toast stuffed with cream cheese and berries
instructions: Flatten bread slices with a rolling pin.
Mix cream cheese with protein powder until smooth.
Spread cream cheese mixture on each bread slice.
Place strawberry slices in a line along one edge.
Roll up tightly from the strawberry side.
Whisk eggs, almond milk, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Dip each roll in egg mixture, coating all sides.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
Cook rolls seam-side down for 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve with sugar-free maple syrup.
